MajorClaims.MC1: I do not approve of this trend due to negative effects such as low quality of life and affecting the environment

Claims.C1: young people tend to study or work in urban areas
Claims.C2: they move to big cities to pursue academic career and find jobs in order to have a higher standard of living
Claims.C3: cities cannot provide adequate space for thousands of dwellers that might lead to poor housing conditions and sanitation

Premises.P1: these provide them many educational opportunities and career potentials
Premises.P2: cities often offer more well-paid jobs and study chances compared to rural areas
Premises.P3: many large companies and universities often locate in cities which are hailed as promising lands to develop their career
Premises.P4: if a gradate stays in the city after leaving his college and seeks a job with good salary instead of returning his village to do farm work, he could perhaps buy a house or his own car after a short time
Premises.P5: the burgeoning number of young adults from the countryside flocking to cities gives rise to overpopulation in cities
Premises.P6: it might put strain on the environment
Premises.P7: If there are more people in the cities, there would be large numbers of vehicles on the road, which causes air pollution
